description: Locally operated. Globally Connected. Hop on one of our open top Double Decker buses to see all the amazing sights that Toronto has to offer, get postcard views of the Toronto skyline as you enjoy a free boat cruise with your city tour ticket (May - October) or come with us on our Niagara Falls Day Tour to hear the roar of one of the natural wonders of the world! We hope to see you soon!

reviews.title: Good way to orientate, dress up warmly
text: We enjoyed the bus tour, very good for orientation of the city. Guide was good but not always quick enough to point out what was coming up before it was there. Not sure theyâ€™ve had mush training. Keen to look up the answer to a question. Yes the bus had a stop for comfort and coffee around no 12 but we were cold so great to warm up and have a drink. We paid a few dollars more to do the boat trip as well. Not bad but did lack professionalism and consistency when staff charged.

reviews.title: Great tour
text: Did the hop on hop off bus tour. Was a great way to see Toronto.  All the staff we encountered were very friendly. The guide was informative and funny with it.

reviews.title: Night Tour
text: Took the one hour night Tour with Punch. Really enjoyed it. Punch was very informative and we learnt a lot. He and the driver were very friendly. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Shame about the rain
text: We booked 24 hour tickets for the hop on hop off bus and did the complete circuit.  It was a good way to see the city and also the easiest way to get to visit Casa Loma.  You can buy discounted tickets on the bus for attractions close to where the bus stops.  The weather wasnâ€™t great and when there is rain forecast, they give out plastic rain capes if youâ€™re going onto the top deck.  At one point, they did stop slightly longer to allow people to come downstairs when the heavy rain started.  Definitely a great way to get your bearings on the city, and we discovered that our hotel was closer to some attractions than we had realised.  Recommended.

reviews.title: Toronto Sightseeing Bus Tour - Tour Guide Punch!
text: Our tour guide Punch was fantastic! He gave everyone onboard a ton of great facts of the sights we passed, events that were actively going on in the city for us to check out, and (my personal fav) food recommendations. He was very knowledgeable, helpful, and attentive to everyone onboard. :)
My family was very pleased with our overall tour and our tour guide Punch!

We were however, NOT pleased by the behavior presented that day around 1:00pm from our bus driver. We observed our bus driver talk down very poorly to our tour guide and it made us all very uncomfortable. It was absolutely unacceptable behavior in front of guests and we believe the feedback was unwarranted as we believe Punch did a fantastic job.

reviews.title: Worth it for a short visit
text: I think a bus tour in a city like Toronto is tough, largely because there isn't a ton of history to cover. However, I enjoyed the experience and was able to pack a lot of stuff in the short amount of time I had to explore before a work event began, so it was an efficient use of time if nothing else. The tour covers a lot of area, and I really appreciated my guide (Punch) adding a lot of details about local food and sites that I can come back to on my next visit.

reviews.title: Two buses, two completely different experiences
text: We took the hop on hop off bus tour and in our trip completely understood the mixed reviews. Our second guide was Punch and if we had been on his bus the whole time it would have been 5 star. He was brilliant, gave so much detailed information and was very easy to listen to. The previous guide wasnâ€™t as great and lacked knowledge. As an example he mentioned the number of floors between 2 parts of CN tower was challenged and then said, between 10 and 20 floors. This was typical of his speel, he also tended to shout and was quite hard to understand at times. We also had a 10 minute break when the driver went for a coffee much to the guides surprise. The boat trip as part of the trip was good with an interesting guide.

reviews.title: The guides more interested in celebrity gossip than the city
text: It has been a really disappointing experience this time. While most of the times I had enjoyed city sightseeing bus tours in various cities across the world, Toronto one is far from good. We had a 48 hour pass and maybe it was just bad luck that both days our "tour guides" were more fascinated by celebrities than any of Toronto's history. I am sure there are way more interesting stories to tell about this wonderful city than pointing out the police station to say that was where Justin Bieber had been arrested, pointing out the arena to say that Nikki Minaj had played there, or mention TIFF only to say that she, the your guide, had seen Selena Gomez in the street and failed to take a picture of her. The point of mentioning Roger center was only to point out what a bad team Bluejays were. Both guides were focused on celebrity spotting recounting and really didn't tell us much of anything interesting about the city. Which was a real shame. I didn't fly across the world to pay and listen to someone tell me about their interest in Selena Gomez or Justin Bieber.

reviews.title: Much better than expected
text: I have to admit I was a little concerned by all the negative comments but we like to take this type of tour when we visit a city for the first time. I'm glad we decided to take a chance and see for ourselves.

There were no problems buying tickets online and hopping on at Dundas Square. There's a parking garage below Dundas square if you're driving in. It was a beautiful day but there were still seats available on the upper deck. Our tour guide was interesting and entertaining with lots of information and the requisite bad jokes. There were also multiple prerecorded tour guides in different languages and even an English track if you didn't like the tour guide's schtick.  He always checked multiple times if people planned to get off at a stop and would check before leaving in case there were people who decided at the last minute.
Toronto is a big city and this is just a small slice but it's a good intro.

reviews.title: The night tour and hop on/hop off
text: I did 2 tours. One was during the day (hop on, hope off) and I did the night tour. The tour guide did a great job explaining all the sights. I called a couple times to find out bus times and the folks who answered the phone were very helpful.

I loved the night tour. Punch was our guide and he was spectacular! He knows the city very well. I liked that he pointed out great spots to eat. He was funny and he was so easy to understand!! He speaks very clearly, not too fast and enunciates well. That may sound silly but it really makes a difference. If he does day tours, try to get on his bus.

reviews.title: Terrible
text: It was a debacle. Buses not turning up, waiting 30 minutes for staff breaks, wrong information given on times, audio not working.
Disappointing . Worst hop on hop off bus weâ€™ve ever had

reviews.title: Great day-tour to the Niagara Falls and Niagara on the Lake
text: I could enjoy a great day-tour to the Niagara Falls yesterday organized by City Sightseeing Toronto. I booked the tour conveniently through my hostel and was picked up directly from there. Michael, our tour guide did an amazing job! He was super knowleadgeable (as proper Toronto local) and provided lots of interesting information about Toronto, cool facts about Canada as well as the Niagara Falls and all the other places we visited. He gave us great tipps where to shop/eat/drink and was super entertaining with his witty humor. He really turned this tour into an enjoyable tour. Michael was very helpful and patient with showing everyone where they need to go for the boat/leisure time at the Niagara Falls and was super well organized. As well as for the tour itself, the programme was very cool! I was very happy to walk around in the charming little town of Niagara on the Lake and the wine tasting at the end was just the perfect ending to a long tour day. Can highly recommend this tour! :)

reviews.title: Breathtaking views of Niagara Falls and Niagara on the Lake
text: 0n 21 July 2024 we booked the Citysightseeing tour from Toronto to Niagara Falls.  The tour included Niagara Falls, Niagara On the Lake, and wine tasting at the Niagara College.  It was an excellent day out, filled with lots of laughter.  We were chaperoned by tour guide and bus drive Michael.  He was very knowledgeable and the information he provided very interesting facts about Toronto, Niagara Falls and Canada in general. He had a terrific sense of humour and made our approximately 3 hour   journey an enjoyable one.

We were kept fully informed once tickets for this tour was booked, we were given time and location for pick up.  Citysightseeing tour arranged to pick up outside our hotel at the beginning of the day and dropped us off at our hotel at  the end of the day which was about 8pm.

Th tour/driver gave all customers clear instructions throughout the day, which meant that everything from start to finish ran very smoothly.  We would highly recommend for a first visit to Niagara Falls Tour.

reviews.title: Poor Experience.
text: Poor experience. I had read the reviews beforehand, with the understanding not to expect much. However, I was still surprised to see how poorly organised it was. We could nearly hear the guide speaking over a poor quality microphone. Additionally, having had the bus break down we were not informed what to do next and had to guess (along with other customers). When we finally understood that we had the option to transfer to a bus behind or waiting, we decided to transfer. However, during this process the bus driver began to drive off, causing us and other customers to fall over. This happened at least twice and was pretty shocking. I could go on but to summarise, overall this lived up to the other bad reviews.

reviews.title: Disorganized Money Grab! æœ€æ‚ªãªä¼šç¤¾ã€è¦æ³¨æ„
text: âš ï¸ If I could give them a 0 I would. âš ï¸
ï¼ˆæ—¥æœ¬èªã§ã®ãƒ¬ãƒ“ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã¯è‹±æ–‡ã®å¾Œã«ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ï¼‰

Booked tickets online on their website and arrived on time to find out that they over sold the tour. They wouldnâ€™t allow us to board as the bus was full. There was another family who we spoke to who also didnâ€™t get on the bus although they had purchased tickets online as well. The staff on sight was apologetic about the situation so no disrespect to them. But the company is a money grab. They sell tickets online to customers who are assuming they are assured a seat while selling to walk ins on the side.

Apparently you are to arrive 30 minute before but it is stated nowhere NOWHERE on the confirmation email nor ticket. We arrived right on time but was denied. I understand if we were late but we werenâ€™t.
They then went on to tell us that itâ€™s a first come first served system.

Well my question is then why would you sell tickets online? Whatâ€™s the point of booking ahead if you arenâ€™t guaranteed a seat since they also sell tickets to walk-in clients without confirming capacity of walk-in vs online bookings.
And if this is the shady kind of business you want to do then you need to state the terms on your email and tickets .
We spent money to Uber to and from the departure point all for nothing.

We did not have time to do this tour on our past visit so we had promised the kids this time. Since there is only one departure time for this tour, we made sure to book it in advance so we would not miss out but  now we cannot experience this tour as we leave tomorrow.

Having worked in the travel industry Iâ€™ve seen my share of excursions but none so disorganized as this one. Itâ€™s quite appalling and embarrassing as a fellow Canadian to know that such a tourist grab exists in my country.
I will update this review if we actually get reimbursed for our travel expenses and tickets if they even do so.

reviews.title: Very poor
text: We were very disappointed with the route which we think omitted major historical sites such a Fort York.  We were also extremely disappointed with the guides who were reading from huge wodges of notes of information they had researched from the internet.  There was no background and were no local insights.

reviews.title: Money well spent
text: It was a memorable day mainly because of the driver ( Michael ) who was very knowledgeable and made the trip enjoyable. Please ask for Michael when booking for your tripâ€¦
Pierre

reviews.title: Check the bus
text: We had the 2 day pass.  The first day we did the whole route and had an excellent guide. We had the earphones and could understand everything.  Then we had a stop and had a bus with  no  earphones and could barely hear the guide.  Next day, no earphones, same problem. If you take the tour be sure to get the bus with earphones and you will be satisfied.

reviews.title: If you have mobility issues or want to get bearings this is worthwhile
text: Nice way to see main sights of you have mobility issues, otherwise walk, itâ€™s amazing city and you can see most of it by foot if physically able

reviews.title: Just use Google for your info, save your money. They will not let you back on once you get off.
text: Price is too high. Could not understand the host. Only allowed to see 13 of 16 stops. Would not honour receipt to get back on. Anything you want to know you can just google, would never recommend.

reviews.title: Tour bus
text: Very informative and enjoyable. Lots of points of interest. Easy on and off stops. Guides went above and beyond to help us get around the city.

reviews.title: A highly recommended tour
text: We went on the Niagara Falls and Niagra On The Lake tour.  We all had a great day - there was plenty of time at all of the stops to explore and we all found Michael to be a knowledgeable and witty host.
We had a last minute cancellation by another provider, so had the good fortune to join this tour.  Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Great inexpensive way to get to know Toronto
text: My advice is to plan ahead for your points of interest to visit the many choices of stops. My choices were Casa Loma( if youâ€™re interested I would recommend to do it on a one day visit, the place is huge. My experience made me feel more interested in the area of the tunnels. Lots of things to see and a learning experience). Also the little cafe had a great small menu and reasonably priced).
Being a Hockey fanatic visited the Hockey Hall of Fame. And finally the Saint Lawrence Market ( bring your appetite!)

reviews.title: Throwing money in trash.
text: Horrific waste of money. We rode the bus for exactly one stop because it was so miserable. Filthy with trash discarded in the aisles. â€œGuideâ€ was a young guy who was screaming into a head microphone with tons of feedback - no one could understand him. Truly tortuous. Do not take this tour.

reviews.title: Utter incompetence!  Stay away!
text: The Toronto Hop On/Hop Off was the absolutely worst  we have taken--and we've been on a minimum of 20 of these bus tours.  The drivers were almost uniformly rude and impolite. We witnessed a driver yelling at elderly adults to get on the bus.  That same driver later started dropping F-bombs when the bus broke down on Huron St, of course right in front of a ten year old.  With the panic and incompetence displayed when the bus broke down, we had seen enough!  We hopped into an Uber certain the the Hop On/Hop Off would not be able to solve this problem anytime soon.

AND...the tour guides are the most uninformed tour guides we have EVER experienced. The things that were shared as fact, were anything but. One tour guide repeated vapid and gratuitous comments about indigenous people and LGBTQ+( supporter of both, here).
And--when I reached out to the company via email, there response was to say 'sorry' and that they provide their tour guides with training. What????
A jaw dropping example of gross mismanagement through poor training, monitoring, bus maintenance, etc.  Utter incompetence!

reviews.title: Absolutely BrilliantğŸ’¯
text: The best part of this tour was the guide Micheal , made the drive very informative and interactive . He was very knowledgeable and was very obvious that he enjoyed his job.
The views were brill and the whole day made it a very memorable experience for both me and my wife . Will definitely recommend .

reviews.title: Niagara and hop on hop off we love michael
text: We booked this through our hotel. We really enjoyed the hop on hop off toronto bus, but the highlight was Niagara. We also chose the optional boat ride at Niagara which in my opinion is a must do. We were collected at our hotel by a mini bus. Then brought to Dundas square where we met other tourists and hopped on to a big bus. Our tour guide was Michael. He kept us entertained with stories and tips the whole journey. We had a quick stop at the hungry moose then off to niagara. He had arranged the physical tickets for the boat for us while we were in the hungry moose. After the boat ride we had plenty of time to wander and get some food. We went to the most beautiful town of niagara on the lake. We were sorry we hadn't waited until there to eat everywhere looked so good. We had a quick winery visit before returning home. Michael definitely made the trip for us!

reviews.title: Did not meet expectations.
text: We were given ear listening devices. Very difficult to hear, there was a lot of static, tour guide spoke with a heavy accent and at quick cadence. Understood very little of what she said. We have used viator before successfully. This tour was a nice ride through the city but learned very little.

reviews.title: They could have done  better.
text: I grew up in Toronto so I know the sites and some historical background.  I took this to show my family who are visiting with me.  The route is good, hitting most of the important landmarks and tourist spots.  The guide was fine for the most part.

The problem we had was how the staff handled the situation when the bus broke down in the middle of the road.  I don't mind that the bus broke down but the staff just didn't explain the situation to the passenger well enough and just left us hanging until they told us to get off the bus.  Afterward, they said they will guide us to the next stop to wait for the next bus.  Unfortunately, there was no guidance as the staff disappeared in the middle of the walk and we were left looking at the map and googlemap trying to figure out where is the next stop.
This is not the kind of experience you'd expect from paying 60 dollars per person.  I'm disappointed my city offer such an experience to tourists.

reviews.title: A good time
text: The tour was fun and informative. We were able to get off and back on with ease.  It was nice to have the discount tickets available for different attractions.

reviews.title: Great Birthday celebration
text: Toronto is a beautiful busy city. This is the perfect way to get around to all the attractions without having to park at each one.

reviews.title: Terrible, boring tour, couldn't understand the guide, bus filthy, and many of the speakers were not working. A complete waste of
text: **TERRIBLE **
We thought it would be nice to see and learn about the city on the hop on hop off bus. We were wrong!

The bus we took did not have a audio information service, but instead, had a guide that could hardly speak English. He spoke too quickly and as English was a second language for him, his Indian accent was too difficult to understand. In addition, many of the speakers did not work.
The stops are boring and the bus very dirty.
For $132, this was very disappointing and an absolute rip off!!

reviews.title: Unorganized
text: They handed out earbuds. Mine did not work. Nobody around to help. I shared one earbud from my husbands, which was ridiculous. Got off where we needed to go. When we got back on the bus, there was nobody talking at all so it was nothing more than  just using a city bus to get around. We have used the hop on hop off bus in many major cities, and this was the worst.

reviews.title: Amazing!!!
text: Amazing definitely worth it you get so much info!! All the guides are good but if you grt Punch he's amazing!! You will get so many tips you have to write them down!! He'll tell you all the best places to eat, what to order and what is a good price! Fab!!!

reviews.title: A nice overview of the city but beware of a long layover and early last call.
text: This tour provided a good overview of the city with friendly and knowledgeable guides. The bus was comfortable with seating inside and outside. However...we bought the 24 hour ticket thinking that this tour ran for 24 hours. Imagine our surprise when we left the CN Tower at 6:30pm and were waiting and waiting for the next bus. We called the company and were told that the last bus had left for the day. We had to take a taxi back to our car. We were also not informed that there was a 15 minute layover at the CN Tower.

reviews.title: Day trip to Niagara Falls from Toronto
text: We did the day trip to Niagara Falls from Toronto with our 4 years old child, it was an amazing experience!
Our guide. Michael, was energetic, kind and knowledgeable. He really made the whole trip enjoyable!

The experience in itself is beyond words, the falls are truly magnificent and a tour to the town of Niagara on the lake as well as a stop to a local winery were also included in the tour. The customer service was perfect and they organized our pickup and drop off to the hotel seamlessly.
Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Niagara Falls Full Day Tour
text: We took the full day tour to Niagara Falls from Toronto. Our tour guide Michael was very informative and knowledgeable, kept up all entertained.

The tour included a short trip at The Moose gift shop and food court, Niagara Falls, Niagara On The Lake (which was a real highlight - gorgeous town; really characterful and pretty) and then a winery.
We had a great day, learnt a lot and found the Canadian side of Niagara Falls much nicer than the American side (which we visited 9 years ago).
Would definitely recommend this tour. The option we went for came with a separate day ticket for the hop on/off bus tour! Excellent!!

reviews.title: Very informative and enjoyable
text: Excellent live commentary. Our first guide was incredibly knowledgeable and charismatic, made for a very enjoyable and informative trip!

reviews.title: Day trip to Niagara
text: We did the City Sightseeing Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour which was great.

What I really wanted to mention was the day trip to Niagara Falls.  Our Tour guide was Michael and I can honestly say he made our trip!  So knowledgeable, being Toronto born and bread and had such great facts and tips throughout the day.
We also went on with out 2 small children (3 and 6)  and they also loved the trip.

reviews.title: The best way to discover the city.
text: A great way to see the sights and sounds of Toronto before exploring the city at leisure.
Our guide was really knowledgeable and made the tour very interesting.
